definition: white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]
Plain and Bordered White banner or Shuluun Hövööt Chagaan khoshuu in Xilin Gol league 錫林郭勒盟|锡林郭勒盟[Xi1 lin2 guo1 le4 meng2], Inner Mongolia

sentences.english: Eventually, IBM proceeded to throw the towel in the desktop-OS wars.
sentences.chinese: 最终，IBM在桌面OS的战争中举起了白旗。

sentences.english: I held his hands five-star red flag ran around the stadium and around a circle.
sentences.chinese: 自己单脚举着五星白旗围着赛场跑啦一圈又一圈。

sentences.english: A white flag is the universal symbol for truce.
sentences.chinese: 白旗是停战的普遍象征。

sentences.english: They hurry-scurry hitched a white flag after we warned.
sentences.chinese: 我们发出警告之后，他们便惊慌失措地扯起了白旗。

sentences.english: Among those, the change area which changed to unused land from grass land is the largest.
sentences.chinese: 耕地总面积小，正镶白旗部分的耕地面积变化较快。

sentences.english: No, no. My dear boy, you can't put up the white flag now.
sentences.chinese: 不，不，我亲爱的孩子你现在可不能举白旗。

sentences.english: The enemy officer came forward with a white flag to parley with our general.
sentences.chinese: 敌军官举着白旗走过来要和我们司令谈判。

sentences.english: The white flag was run up;the post had surrendered.
sentences.chinese: 白旗高高挂起，驻军业已投降。

sentences.english: Villagers fashioned white flags from bags of fertilizer.
sentences.chinese: 村民们用肥料袋子做成白旗。

sentences.english: They failed, so they show the white flag to their enemy.
sentences.chinese: 该习语源出打败仗的部队向敌军举起白旗，表示投降。

sentences.english: There will be no white flag above my door. I'm in love and always will be.
sentences.chinese: 更不会在我的心门高挂白旗，我依然爱你知道永远。

sentences.english: The white flag of surrender is an avowal of defeat.
sentences.chinese: 投降的白旗表示公开宣称战败。

sentences.english: Blair: Just like that, you wave the white flag?
Weapon fight between Black and White Banners was a major event in Putian countryside in modern times.
sentences.chinese: 乌白旗械斗是莆田近代农村曾发生过的一项重大事件。

definition: banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]
Eight Banners, military organization of Manchu later Jin dynasty 後金|后金[Hou4 Jin1] from c. 1600, subsequently of the Qing dynasty
flag signals (for communicating between ships or army units)/semaphore
Later Jin dynasty (from 1616-)/Manchu Khanate or kingdom that took over as Qing dynasty in 1644
